intro: Melanium scabrum, commonly known as rough melanium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate with a hairy surface, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Melanium scabrum is often found in woodland and scrubland habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
